results.title: Building an organisation
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, John Kemeny, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle”.
In this film we witness obstacles encountered by a new community action organization in Buffalo, New York, as it begins to work for recognition. Award: Columbus

results.title: A Trip to Mexico: an integrated approach
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
An enthusiastic approach to integrated curriculum at Southvale Primary School. A program full of ideas where the subject areas are integrated into a complex unit of work based on a trip to China and Mexico.

results.title: Student participation
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
A look at various aspects of student participation in a number of different primary schools in Victoria. Covers curriculum decision-making in the classroom, students running school assemblies, writing school rules and regional meetings of school leaders.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley, Victoria. Ministry of Education and TV Ed Productions

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Chalkface co-editor, Piri White, introduces the work of teachers and students at Richmond Primary School in linking art across the curriculum. The theme of the program is “monsters and things are not always what they seem”

results.title: How do you spell my name in chinese?
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Piri White, co-editor of “Chalkface” explores a way of introducing a language, in this case Chinese, to a primary school class.

results.title: I like maths
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Neville Stanley and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chalkface”.
Introduces three teachers from Corio West Primary School who have developed a series of mathematical “games” to make mathematics more relevant to real-life situations.

results.title: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: The East Reservoir Neighbourhood Renewal was set up in 2006 when the area was identified as being in need and enabling residents to help create a community action plan. Part of this process has been to invite seven members of the community to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop to tell very personal stories the reflect life in the suburb.
results.title_for_label: Celebrations of people and place : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: You really had to be there!
results.creator_credit: Dean Turner, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dean Turner cherishes the Punk Rock nights at the Arthouse in North Melbourne, where you could drink, hang out and have your five minutes of fame. Poverty is their way of life, but music uplifts them.
